description: Create a polished file explorer slide template (tree sidebar + code viewer), building on existing FileExplorer.vue

key_decisions.decision: Code viewer only — no description panel
key_decisions.rationale: Not enough slide real estate for descriptions. Code speaks for itself. Keeps things simple.
Presenter navigates the tree live during the presentation

key_decisions.decision: Convention-based folder structure via Vite glob import
key_decisions.rationale: FileExplorer.vue already uses import.meta.glob — proven pattern, files on disk ARE the tree data

key_decisions.decision: Build on existing FileExplorer.vue and FileTreeItem.vue
key_decisions.rationale: Components already work. Focus on polish and integration, not rewriting.

key_decisions.decision: Style upgrade based on interactive file tree
key_decisions.rationale: Current FileExplorer works but could look better. Draw from the interactive_file_tree's visual quality.

key_decisions.decision: Optional title — explorer fills full slide by default, title shown if provided
key_decisions.rationale: Maximizes code readability when no title needed, but stays consistent with other templates when a title is desired.

high_level: Polished, reusable file explorer slide component
Build on existing FileExplorer.vue — improve styling, not rewrite
Easy to use: just create files in decks/ and reference with dir prop
mid_level: Move components into project's component system
Ensure glob import path works from registered location
Create slide template files (slide.md, description.md, example.md)
